text.p: Suppose the function [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^3\rightarrow \mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] is given by
for all vectors [mathjaxinline]\left[ \begin{array}{c} a_1 \\ a_2\\ a_3 \end{array} \right] \in \mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline].
For what matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]T(x) = Ax[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]x \in \mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline]?

div.p: To enter the matrix [mathjaxinline]\left[ \begin{array}{ccc} 0& 1& 2 \\ 1& 2& 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], type [[0,1,2],[1,2,3]]. (Type the same thing if you want to enter the augmented matrix [mathjaxinline]\left[ \begin{array}{cc:c} 0& 1& 2 \\ 1& 2& 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline].)

tr.td: [mathjax]T\left[ \begin{array}{c} a_1 \\ a_2 \\ a_3 \end{array} \right] = \left[ \begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ -1 & 1 & 0 \end{array} \right] \left[ \begin{array}{c} a_1 \\ a_2 \\ a_3 \end{array} \right][/mathjax]

font.p: Since [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is multiplication by a matrix, it is a linear transformation.
